events.name: Brainstorming the Future
events.description:
We'll talk about how we want to build our community, what we want to do at monthly meetups, and plan our next community-at-large event!

Bring snacks/drinks to share! ﻿

events.name: Brainstorming Part II
events.description: We'll talk about future plans for our group and the change we want to make in Fresno. Newcomers always welcome!

events.name: Hackathon 101
events.description: Curious about hackathons? Want to know what it's like to participate in a hackathon or codefest? Or maybe you're an experienced hackathon veteran who wants to share some words of wisdom? Join FTW as we discuss the 101s of hackathons and other coding events. This event will follow Hack 4 Change Fresno County, part of the National Day of Civic Hacking. As always, people of all genders and coding backgrounds are welcome!

events.name: Wordpress + Parallax
events.description: Join FTW as we go over the basics of Wordpress! We'll show you how to set up your own website and how to install a cool parallax theme. Bring your laptops!

events.name: Featured Speaker: Roberta Baber
events.description:
Join FTW as we welcome Roberta Baber, a veteran of the tech scene with over 50 years of experience! Roberta will discuss her experiences working as a woman in tech. As she explains, "I think it is important for younger people to understand what technology and women in technology went through. That way they can stand on our shoulders, and not have to go through battles we have already fought and won."

About Roberta Baber: Roberta learned to program in 1963 and has been coding ever since. Her work experience includes 17 years as a computer programmer and systems analyst for Lockheed and L.A. City Schools. Later, she taught Computer Information Systems and Computer Information Technology at Fresno State and Fresno City College. She's the co-author of “Computers and Your Future” (1995) and codes in COBOL, Fortran, BASIC, C++, Pascal, and Assembler (for IBM mainframes).

The door code is 8756#. Please be respectful of the space we are sharing. Use discretion and please do not give this code out.

events.name: Women and Tech Social Hour
events.description: Come meet other Central Valley women interested in technology! We'll chat about ideas for upcoming events and programs.

events.name: Bootstrap 101
events.description: Learn about Twitter's Bootstrap, the free front-end framework you can use to jumpstart your website! This is a working meeting, so bring your laptop!

events.name: Starting Out with Start-ups
events.description: If you read anything about the tech industry, one hyphenated word will make a frequent appearance: start-up. At this month's meetup, we'll talk about entrepreneurship and what you need to know about starting your own business. Marianne Dunklin, professor of Business Administration at Fresno City College and entrepreneurship expert, will join us and share her invaluable advice and experience!

events.name: Holiday Party at Dusty Buns!
events.description:
Fresno Tech Women is joining with GDG Fresno for a special holiday party!

*Bring a toy to donate to Toys for Tots and your Dusty Buns meal is FREE!

*Raffle for a Chromecast!

*Fun and games with GDG and FTW members!

Hope to see you there!

events.name: Hour Of Code
events.description: The Hour of Code is a global movement reaching tens of millions of students in 180+ countries. Anyone, anywhere can organize an Hour of Code event. One-hour tutorials are available in over 30 languages. No experience needed. Ages 4 to 104.

events.name: "Learn to Code" Sites + One-on-One Help!
events.description:
Back in the olden days, the only way to learn to code was to find a local class or pick up an "HTML for Dummies" book. But now there's dozens of free and nearly free online tutorials to help you jump start your programming skills. Join FTW as we review some of the most popular learn-to-code websites. After the presentation, experts will be on hand to help you get started with the site of your choice.

Are you a more experienced developer? Come share some advice for the programming newbies in our group. Working on a project and need some help? This is a great opportunity to ask fellow developers for feedback and assistance.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be downstairs in the Endeavor conference room.

events.name: Android Fundamentals Study Jam Kick Off!
events.description:
Google Developers Study Jams is a free series of global, community-run, in-person study groups. The first jam session is presented in partnership with Udacity and will follow their Android Fundamentals curriculum. This series will be led by certified Google Developer Group facilitators and will meet once weekly for 7 weeks.

Once we get through the class there will be one last meeting in which everyone will show off their final project and the person with the best final project will walk home with a special prize!

Please RSVP and also sign up here,

https://www.udacity.com/account/affiliate/StudyJam

We suggest you bring your own devices so that it will be easier for you to work in one computer but we will be using a computer lab for those who would like to use those.

events.name: Q&A with UX Designers
events.description:
Interested in user experience design and research? This month, we're featuring a virtual Q&A session with three UX specialists at IBM! Come prepared with questions about this exciting field.

Featuring:

Ashwini Kamath - User Experience Designer, IBM Watson Group

cary-anne olsen - User Experience Researcher, IBM

Natalie Miller - User Experience Design & Research, IBM
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs in the Geekwise Academy room. Someone will be posted at the door to let you in, but please let us know if you will be late.

events.name: Art+Feminism Wikipedia Edit-a-thon
events.description:
This satellite event is one of many simultaneous edit-a-thons happening March 6 - 8, across the globe. The strategy is two-fold: 1. Attempt to diminish the disparity between male and female artists represented on Wikipedia 2. Get more women editing on Wikipedia.

Catalogs and other publications from the Fresno Art Museum library and Curatorial Department will be available for use during the event. Please feel free to bring your personal copies of publications that you would like to share with others for the purpose of this event.
This event will be held from 11 AM - 5 PM on March 7 and March 8.
More info here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/Fresno/ArtAndFeminism

events.name: International Women's Day 2015: Connect. Create. Celebrate.
events.description:
On March 14, Women Techmakers presents the biggest event celebrating women in tech in the Central Valley. Join us for this amazing opportunity!

International Women's Day is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. Our Fresno event will include special community-building activities, two Q&A panels featuring local women leaders, and a catered lunch. People of all genders and backgrounds are welcome to participate.

To reserve your spot, fill out the sign-up form available at http://goo.gl/forms/S5DHw7JJq2.

events.name: Fresno Mini Maker Faire
events.description:
(This event is to promote the Mini Maker Faire. Please feel free to attend the event on your schedule.)

ABOUT FRESNO MINI MAKER FAIRE:
2014 was the inaugural year for the Fresno Mini Maker Faire and what a tremendous year it was! The 2nd Fresno Mini Maker Faire will once again be hosted by the Fresno Art Museum at the Fresno Art Museum + Radio Park on Saturday, April 11, 2015, from 10AM to 6PM.

This is a community driven event in which volunteers from the community and community organizations partner and participate in the planning, production, and execution of the event. If you would like to volunteer please send and email to: [masked]

There will be approximately 100 different makers participating in this year’s event. If you are interested in showcasing your wares and perhaps even demonstrating the process, please consider submitting a maker application at http://www.fresnominimakerfaire.com.

There will also be fun hands-on activities for children and adults alike, as well as food, beverages and entertainment for all to enjoy!

The Fresno Art Museum is very excited for the opportunity to combine the fields of Science and Technology with our expertise in the Arts for this incredible event.

Fresno Mini Maker Faire is independently organized and operated under license of O’Reilly Media.

events.name: Women Freelancers and Business Owners
events.description:
Ever wanted to break away from the 8 to 5 and switch to contract work but didn't know how to get clients? Have an idea for an awesome product but don't know how to go about building a business? Join us on April 19th for a panel of amazing women who have experience freelancing or running a business. It's an amazing opportunity to learn from their mistakes, pick up some invaluable resources if you're just getting started yourself, and hopefully get a realistic picture of what you're getting into before making the leap.

We are meeting in the Geekwise Academy (upstairs) at Bitwise Industries.

events.name: Coffee + Code
events.description:
Join Women Techmakers Fresno for a Coffee + Code meetup at Mia Cuppa! Have questions about coding? This is a great chance to share your latest project with the group for feedback.

Please note: Unfortunately, we had to cancel the outing to MakerFaire in San Mateo. The Coffee + Code meetup is replacing that event.

events.name: Introduction to Ruby!
events.description:
Join Women Techmakers for an intro to Ruby! Ruby is a programming language that powers some of the most popular sites on the web. Frank West from CenCal Ruby User Group will present an intro and demo of Ruby. 

Want to give Ruby a test drive before our meetup? Check out TryRuby.org for a fun interactive tutorial!

events.name: Getting Started with Polymer
events.description:
Join Women Techmakers Fresno as GDG Lead James Cha leads us through the exciting world of Polymer! Polymer is a web component library that helps you quickly build custom web elements using less code. This is a great opportunity to sharpen your web dev skills before attending GDG DevFest on October 17!

Learn more about Polymer: https://www.polymer-project.org/1.0/docs/start/what-is-polymer.html

events.name: Code + Chat
events.description: Have a project you're working on or want to meet other women in tech in the Central Valley? This is a great opportunity to chat with fellow members! Bring your laptops if you want to share some recent projects or get advice from other attendees.

events.name: Hello, Emmet!
events.description:
Want to learn more about Emmet, the awesome plug-in that will take your coding to super speed levels? Join Women Techmakers as Fresno City prof (and WTM organizer) Rio Waller leads us through the ins and outs of Emmet!

If you'd like to follow along, please bring your laptop and make sure you have access to one of the text editors or IDEs listed here: http://emmet.io/download/

Please RSVP if you plan to attend!

events.name: GDG Fresno DevFest 2015
events.description:
Join GDG Fresno, GDG Visalia, GDG Oakdale, GDG Modesto and Women Techmakers Fresno for one of the biggest technology events in the Central Valley!

GDG DevFest 2015 has something for everyone:

• Want some hands-on coding experience? DevFest has tracks for Beginners, Intermediates, and Advanced for everything from HTML 101 to Angular JS.

• Like to hear from the experts? Don't miss talks from Google pros like Sandeep Dinesh and Jenny Tong.

• Working on a big project? Get some advice from Google Developer Experts during on-site office hours.

Want more info? Visit devfest.gdgfresno.com!

events.name: Free Resources with FCPL
events.description:
Join Women Techmakers Fresno for a special presentation from the Fresno County Public Library! This event will be particularly helpful to anyone on the job search or starting their own business. A FCPL librarian will give us a customized overview of all of the library's fantastic (and free!) online resources. Not a FCPL member? You can sign up for a library card at this meetup!

We will meet at Bitwise Industries in the Geekwise classroom. This presentation is part of the WOW (Without Walls) Library initiative.

events.name: CodeGirl Screening at Fresno City College
events.description:
Check out the trailer for CodeGirl - Watch NOW

5:30pm Reception in OAB Auditorium Entrance!  First 50 folks get a Thank YOU GIFT!!!!!  

Event Flyer

events.name: Getting Ready for International Women's Day 2016!
events.description:
We will discuss plans for our annual International Women's Day Celebration! The celebration is our chance to honor and encourage all of the amazing tech women in the Central Valley. Have an idea for what you want to see this year? Want to get involved as a volunteer or activity leader? Come to this meeting and share your thoughts!

View the video from the 2015 International Women's Day Global Event Series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p_o_JWXTVtg
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs in the Geekwise classroom. Please be on time so you can access the building!

events.name: Prep for International Women's Day 2016!
events.description: Want to volunteer or lead a session at our 2016 celebration of International Women's Day? Come to this meetup to learn more!
events.how_to_find_us: New Location: Bitwise South Stadium! Room details TBA

events.name: International Women's Day Celebration
events.description: Join Women Techmakers Fresno as we celebrate International Women's Day! For more information and to sign up, visit wtm.gdgfresno.com! (Please make sure you register at wtm.gdgfresno.com to guarantee your spot!)

events.name: Women Techmakers May Meetup
events.description:
Women Techmakers monthly meetup! Come meet other awesome women in tech.

At our May meetup, we'll:

• Recap our 2016 International Women's Day Celebration

• Learn about Google's new Women Techmakers program

• Socialize and meet other local women in tech!

**Important Announcement**

Women Techmakers Fresno has a position open for a new lead! If you are interested in this role, come to Bitwise at 12:30 and Rio and Victoria will answer any questions you have. Can't make this meeting but still interested? Message us on Meetup and we'll schedule a Hangout.

events.name: WTM Social / Victoria Going Away Party
events.description: We each pay for our own food and some of us will bring dessert!  :)
events.how_to_find_us: We will be easy to find

events.name: Data Visualization
events.description:
Data visualization is the graphical display of abstract information. Important stories live in our data and data visualization is a powerful means to discover and understand them, and then present them to others. 

During the July meeting, our co-lead organizer, Nancy Mohamed, and Fresno State graphic design professor, Rusty Robison, will lecture on the principles and usage of data visualization then conduct an activity using the information presented.

Please bring your own device. No coding experience required!

events.name: Tour Fresno Ideaworks
events.description:
For this month's meeting, we're taking a field trip! We are going to check out The Fresno Ideaworks space and get a demonstration of their super awesome Sumobots. 

This meeting is a great opportunity to bring along your kids. It's a chance for them to see the back-end work of an electronic toy.

No devices—tablets, laptops, etc.—necessary!
events.how_to_find_us: Meet us in front of Fresno Ideaworks

events.name: Google VR
events.description:
Come and learn about Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality. We'll see VR headsets, Tango, and some code. 

We (Women TechMakers Fresno) will join GDG Fresno for Google VR this month (sorry for the late notice).
events.how_to_find_us: GeekWise Classroom on the lower level.

events.name: Valley DevFest 2016
events.description:
The Central California Google Developer Groups (GDGs)—Fresno, Modesto, Oakdale, Visalia—are proud to host the 2016 ValleyDevFest, the biggest tech conference in the Central Valley! This Googley event will cover an array of topics—Android, Cloud, Web, and so much more.
Don't miss your chance to geek out with other techies in our great Valley!

YOU MUST BUY A TICKET TO ATTEND!

events.name: Recruitment for 2017 International Women's Day Celebration Committee
events.description:
Long time no see, folks! 

Now, that GDG Fresno's DevFest is good and done, it's Women Techmakers' turn to have an awesome event! We will be recruiting coordinators for the various committees that will be set up for the 2017 International Women's Day Celebration happening this spring.

If you're interested in being involved, please fill out this form to let us know how you'd like to help: https://goo.gl/forms/3GbrJvisGCXJ8cZj2
And attend the meeting, of course!

events.name: Holiday Potluck
events.description:
Happy Holidays, Techmakers!

We will be celebrating this jolly (and cold) time of the year with a potluck. So, bring a dish—and maybe wear an ugly Christmas sweater?

PS GDG Fresno will be there too!

events.name: Women's Rights in the Workplace
events.description:
Ana de Alba, a local attorney at Lang, Richert, & Patch, will be giving a lecture on women's rights in the workplace, especially those in male-dominated industries such as, say, the tech industry! Alba represents clients in federal and state courts in employment related matters including wrongful termination, discrimination, sexual harassment, etc.

She is welcoming a Q&A session after her talk, so bring those questions!

events.name: 2017 International Women's Day Celebration
events.description:
Women Techmakers Fresno is proud to be hosting the 2017 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This one-day event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs. With 4 parallel tracks—Google Cloud, UI/UX Design, Makerspace, and Tech Talks—there will be something for everyone! Get ready for engaging talks and discussions, hands-on activities brought to you by Fresno Ideaworks, codelabs, and much more.

Be a part of the Central Valley's largest women's tech conference and buy your ticket today.
https://2017iwdc.eventbrite.com

Read more about the speakers, sessions, and team on the event website: iwdc.wtmfresno.com

Like us on Facebook to receive updates about the event! www.facebook.com/wtmfresno

events.name: May Meeting: Valley DevFest 2017 Committee Recruitment
events.description:
Now, that our 2017 International Women's Day Celebration is good and done, it's time to help GDG Fresno with their awesome annual conference, Valley DevFest! 

During this meeting, they will be recruiting committee members for Valley DevFest 2017 happening this fall. They will talk about the event itself, how you can get involved, and brainstorm ideas on how to make DevFest bigger and better.

If you're interested in being involved, please fill out this form before the meeting to let them know how you'd like to help: https://goo.gl/forms/mgTOyNwVwH55ooP33

events.name: Deep Learning - back to the basics
events.description: The topic will be Deep Learning - back to the basics. Hot dogs / not hot dogs.
events.how_to_find_us: Deep Learning - back to the basics

events.name: Let's connect and start planning IWDC 18!
events.description: Women Techmakers Fresno is proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This one-day event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs. This year's event is going to bigger and better than ever before! Come out and HELP us make it happen!!!

events.name: GDG/WTM Present REBOOT
events.description: Please join the Google Developer Group Fresno and Women Techmakers Fresno as they team up to host REBOOT. A new start to monthly meetups. Meet the new leadership! Learn about GDG, WTM, and the upcoming DevFest! Eat some great food, and of course, hang out with an awesome group of people!

events.name: Using Story to Design Digital Products
events.description:
There are many ways to start designing a digital product. If you are a newcomer, you might be tempted to jump straight into using a graphic design tool, like Sketch or Photoshop. However, there is a high possibility that this path will lead you to do work that is unnecessary. Or, even worse, lead you to design a product that users don’t want. So, what are your options then? Here’s an idea…How about taking a more holistic approach and starting with the story? In her book, The User’s Journey: Storymapping Products that People Love, Donna Lichaw highlights how important the use of story is when designing a new or existing product. She goes on to outline three important techniques: the concept story, the origin story, and the usage story. This talk is an overview of how she describes story when it's applied to product design. It will also walk you through how to use those three techniques with a custom-made example.

Joshwin Greene is a long-time member of GDG Fresno and WTM Fresno. He graduated with a degree in Software Engineering from UC Irvine in 2016. He is also a Fresno City College alumni. He is both a product designer and a software developer. He currently works as a contractor where he designs and develops mobile & web applications.
events.how_to_find_us: We will meet in Sims, upstairs.

events.name: DevFest 2018 Planning Meeting
events.description:
It's time to start rallying the developers of the valley for Google's yearly Dev Fest here in the Central Valley! We're planning to have the conference 10/20 with tracks on IoT, Security, Machine Learning, and a brand new track in Spanish.

If you've never been to DevFest before this is a great meeting to get familiar as we start planning the big day! There'll be snacks and drinks.

Feel free to join us on Slack as well: https://goo.gl/G5VJMz

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Fresno
events.description:
We'll go through code labs related to Google I/O. Food will be provided and we'll have some nice raffle items to give away.

We'll be doing a code lab using Android Studio/Tensor Flow and Visual Studio/Android Studio so if you want to participate please install these in advance. :)

Code to get into Bitwise is 28631#
events.how_to_find_us: We will be in Classroom 1 downstairs. If doors are locked, call or text Csaba at six one five 43O-8O98.

events.name: The Case for Node.js with Rio Waller
events.description: Our July meet-up for GDG/WTM Fresno will be Rio Waller making “The Case for Node.js”. Rio is a full-time professor @ Fresno City College, co-organizer of GDG/WTM Fresno, WTM Leads Mentor for North America and co-founder of Raw Fresno! This is a beginner level talk about Node.js and why you should learn it!

events.name: GDG/WTM Monthly Meetup
events.description:
This month we will be joined by Mariah Caudillo who will be talking all things social media and how she uses social media in her work as a Comprehensive Sexual Health Educator.

Mariah Caudillo is Comprehensive Sexual Health Educator, working with youth in the Central Valley. Using Positive Prevention Plus Curriculum, she covers topics ranging from human reproduction to understanding consent. She uses social media to share the classroom experience with the world.

events.name: GDG/WTM Monthly Meetup
events.description: A Monthly Meetup - GDG and WTM Fresno

events.name: Holiday Party Extravaganza
events.description:
GDG and WTM Fresno would love to celebrate the Holidays with YOU!

Food, Drinks, and Mingling with the AWESOME people in our community.

Attendance is FREE and you will be entered to WIN a Nintendo Switch just by showing up!

Come and join us on Saturday, December 1st from 5:00pm - 8:00pm!

Dress is casual and this event is open to EVERYONE!
Happy Holidays and hope to see you there!

events.name: Rock, Scissors, Paper of Machine Learning!
events.description:
Rio Waller will discuss the basics of machine learning and demo creating a model to predict the classification of an input image as rock, paper or scissors.

organizers.bio: Python, Java, C#, C/C++, ... Organizer/co-organizer of many tech meetups (GDG, JUGs, .NET UGs, ...), founder/co-founder of couple of JUGs, user group junkie.

organizers.name: Andrew Charles R.
organizers.bio: Hi there! I'm an organizer for Root Access, Google Development Group, and Women Techmakers. My hobbies include 3D printing, lasercutting, and making electronics. I'm currently looking for someone who knows about material science for a project.
